comments:
Hi,

I have just upgraded to 3.2M6 and VE 1.2M3.

When I create a new VE Class ( or reopen it from pkg explorer ) I get the following NPEs. Assuming that it might be a caching problem I did a full clean and rebuild. But the error persists. Unable to get any work done with VE - this is critical. Everything else works fine under 3.2M6.

Peter, can Sheehan try to reCreate this one.

>eclipse-platform-3.2M6-win32
>eclipse-PDE-3.2M6
>eclipse-JDT-3.2M6
>emf-sdo-runtime-2.2.0M6
>GEF-runtime-3.2M6
>JEM-runtime-1.2M3
>VE-runtime-1.2M3
>xsd-runtime-2.2.0M5
>wtp-S-1.5M5-200603022222.zip
>subclipse-0.9.108

Rich,
This is quite a mix of runtimes put together... I see at least three JEM runtime if you include VE runtimes and wtp runtimes. Also, VE normally runs with just the base Eclipse SDK. But there is Eclipse Platform, PDE, and JDT in this configuration (and what is subclipse-0.9.108?). 
Do you have any idea whether all this would be compatible?

(In reply to comment #2)
> >eclipse-platform-3.2M6-win32
> >eclipse-PDE-3.2M6
> >eclipse-JDT-3.2M6
> >emf-sdo-runtime-2.2.0M6
> >GEF-runtime-3.2M6
> >JEM-runtime-1.2M3
> >VE-runtime-1.2M3
> >xsd-runtime-2.2.0M5
> >wtp-S-1.5M5-200603022222.zip
> >subclipse-0.9.108

platform, jdt, pde together is the eclipse SDK. It would be quicker and easier to just get the SDK but the combo here is the SDK without the source.
xsd-runtime is just another emf runtime on top of the base eclipse-sdo. We don't  need it, nor does it cause a problem.  However, the XSD is downlevel, it is M5 while the rest of EMF is M6. That shouldn't cause the problem though.

WTP 1.5M5 might be a little bit of problem because they prereq JEM 1.2M2 but JEM 1.2M3 should be API compatible for them. I don't know anything about subclipse except that it is a source version control system.

As for JEM runtimes, WTP does not include JEM, it pre-reqs JEM. That is probably why you see the jem explicitly downloaded because the user didn't realize that VE includes JEM automatically. But since both JEM and VE where the same version, only one version of JEM is installed.

However this does sound like a cache problem. When the cache was cleared was the correct process followed? I.E. Was a VE opened and then closed and then Clean All done? Because Clean All without first opening a VE will not clear the cache.

If this still occurs see if you can give us a copy of the project itself. There may be something wrong with it.

Sorry I could not comment sooner - for some reason none of these comments/changes are being emailed to me any more ? I used to get them all regularly for all the bugs I have logged - I rechecked my Bugzilla preferences - nothing has changed. Are Eclipse mail being filtered out as Spam ? I do not even get it in my Yahoo Bulk folder (rocketmail is yahoo now). Frustrating.

In any case I did follow the "cache clearing instructions" the first time (I had read it in some other bug report). I cleared the cache again to be absolutely sure - rebooted Eclipse and the bug persists.
We don't see anything that could be causing this. Would it be possible to zip up the workspace and send it to me, Rich Kulp? Maybe we can see something in the workspace that is causing the problem.
